unit: Unit 7 | Inference for Quantitative Data: Means
title: Finding the Margin of Error Given an Interval: Vehicle Speed
question_text:
A $95\%$ confidence interval for a car's average speed (mph) on West Street is $(30,40)$.
From this interval, what is the margin of error for the car's average speed (in mph)?

choices.text: It cannot be determined from the information given.

solution:
The margin of error represents the length of point estimate to one of the endpoints of the interval. To put it in simpler terms, it is half the length of the interval.

To find the margin of error in this case, use the following:
$$Margin\quad of\quad Error\quad =\quad \frac { Maximum\quad -\quad Minimum\quad }{ 2 } $$

$$\frac { 40-30 }{ 2 } = 5$$

Explanation of Distractors Choice 'B' is incorrect as this is the range of the interval. Choice 'C' is incorrect as this is the point estimate(center) of the interval. Choice 'D' is incorrect as this represents the endpoints added together.
